intro_bio: Programmer and Software Enthusiast with a deep passion for creating innovative and efficient solutions through coding. With over 8 years of experience, I thrive on solving complex problems and developing high-quality software. Always eager to learn new technologies and explore the latest trends in the programming world. Whether it's building scalable applications, optimizing performance, or mentoring teams, my love for programming drives me to continuously improve and deliver results. I'm always looking for opportunities to challenge myself and contribute to exciting projects in the tech industry.

bio: Senior C# .NET Engineer with over 8 years of experience at leading companies like SoftServe, EPAM Systems, and Luxoft. Skilled in developing and maintaining high-performance applications using .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, and microservices architecture. Proven track record in modernizing legacy systems, integrating third-party services, and optimizing performance. At SoftServe, led the development of a microservices-based financial system serving over 100K users, while at EPAM Systems, successfully migrated applications to .NET Core, enhancing performance and scalability. Adept at mentoring teams, implementing DevOps processes, and ensuring seamless cloud-based solutions using Azure.
about_me.skills_caption: Some technologies I've been worked with:
skills: Languages & Frameworks: C#, .NET Core/6/7/8, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, LINQ
Architecture & Patterns: Microservices, DDD, CQRS, SOLID, Clean Architecture, Design Patterns
Databases: SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Dapper
Cloud & DevOps: Azure (Azure Functions, App Services, CosmosDB), Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions)
Security: OAuth2, JWT, OpenID Connect, API security best practices
Testing & Tools: xUnit, Moq, MSTest, SonarQube, ELK Stack, Serilog, Grafana Frontend (Basic Knowledge): React, Angular, Blazor

section.title: ~/Experience
section.description: My current/past relevant experience. Click [here](/resume) to view my resume.

experience_items.title: Research Result
description: Developed enterprise-level software solutions using ASP.NET MVC and .NET Core.
Designed and implemented database solutions using SQL Server and Entity Framework.
Created RESTful APIs for internal and external integrations.
Optimized application performance and implemented caching mechanisms
Participated in Agile development processes and daily stand-ups.

experience_items.title: Research Result
description: Developed and maintained high-load web applications using .NET Core and Angular.
Migrated legacy .NET Framework applications to .NET Core for improved performance.
Implemented JWT-based authentication and role-based authorization
Integrated third-party services and APIs(with PayPal)
Improved application logging and monitoring with Serilog and Application Insights.

experience_items.title: Research Result
description: Led the development of a microservices-based financial system used by 100K+ users.
Architected and implemented RESTful APIs with ASP.NET Core and Entity Framework Core.
Optimized SQL queries and indexing, reducing database latency by 40%.
Integrated Azure Functions and Event-Driven Architecture (RabbitMQ, Kafka).
Established CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps and Docker/Kubernetes for containerization.
Mentored junior developers and conducted code reviews to ensure best practices.

section.title: ~/Projects
section.description: Some of my most recent or past favorite creations or work.

project_items.description: The microservices-based financial system at SoftServe is a scalable and efficient platform designed to handle financial transactions. It uses microservices architecture to break down complex processes into smaller, independent services that can be developed and scaled separately. This system ensures high performance, security, and seamless integration, serving over 100K users.

At EPAM, I develop high-load web applications using .NET Core and Angular, ensuring scalability and performance. I have experience modernizing legacy systems by migrating them to .NET Core and integrating third-party APIs like Stripe, PayPal, and Twilio. Additionally, I enhance system reliability by implementing advanced logging and monitoring with Serilog and Application Insights

At DataArt, I developed enterprise software using ASP.NET MVC and .NET Core, focusing on performance and scalability. I designed and implemented RESTful APIs for seamless internal and external integrations. Additionally, I optimized application efficiency by implementing caching strategies to enhance responsiveness.
